review_title: Wide disparity in management styles and approach across verticals
pros: Food people has some real brains here. Many intelligent people that also willing to roll up their sleeves for some operational work.
cons: I have been privileged enough to experience most of verticals (business units) across Grab. And I have to say, across different verticals, it feels like you're in completely different company each time. The management, the work ethics, people quality, culture are so different across each other and makes you think, is this even in the same company? Car has mostly operational people, Bike and Express mostly comes from management consulting background, while Food is kind of mixed of both, but generally has more ambitious people. Mart is meh. Most likely have something to do with who is the No.1 person in the respective verticals. Car and bike has intense political scene. Food not so much but hustle culture is more real there.

review_title: A distributed company that is trying to become monolithic, centralised and bureaucratic
pros:
- Great salary (relative to other competitors in the region).
- Excellent culture in engineering where everyone is trying to help each other, despite the very monolithic organisational structure and bloated processes.
- Number of users is HUGE, which means you get to solve interesting engineering problems here (mostly related to scalability and squeezing that last CPU out of your services).
cons:
- Too many teams, too many managers, and too many processes, which leads to...
- Slow development & release cycle, launching a small feature, such as introducing a simple field, would take 2 months at minimum due to the amount of sign-offs required between all parties.
- Very monolithic - most engineering orgs are separated into 3 core functions: QA, eng and product. They only work with each other when there is a project, and as a result getting each other's time to work on non-project-related work is extremely difficult.
- Top-down mandates are handed once in awhile, and low-level engineers and non-department-heads are NOT consulted or informed beforehand. Expect a "wtf pikachu" moment every year or so. These mandates should not even be "confidental" per se (like the change to Grab's working arrangement globally).
- The HR (POPs) function isn't that great, as they tend to not want to add additional work for themselves, and they're not proactive by any means. They'll only help you if it's in their SOP to do so (or bumps up their KPIs), otherwise expect standard refusals for your tiny requests with a limited amount of detail provided.

pros: 1. salary is ok 2. office is quite modern and comfortable 3. company name on CV helps
cons: Nepotism and Politics are at the core of the company's culture. 1. The majority of the Directors are all connected by bonds of friendships which leads to a company wide mechanism of favoritism. Their skills and abilities do not justify their responsibilities, positions, and salaries (the demonstration is also available in the current share price and performance). The overall environment within the company (Grab Indonesia) is described by the vast majority of the employees as toxic and political. Many of them however (including me) decide to close an eye or look the other way to bring home a good salary. 2. The overall performance and results achieved by employees are not nearly as important as the relationships within the company. There are employees who got one promotion after another (I admit, myself included) just because they were closer/people pleaser) to their manager, while others with probably better performances and skills have lagged behind, often being moved around departments to avoid giving promotions. 3. The big lie on layoff avoidance. Whenever the company decides to fire people (regardless whether it is one or multiple individuals at the same time), in order to avoid paying this employee's severance package, they engage in unethical behaviors aimed at damaging the employee’s self esteem and team relationships, which often ends with a resignation. Many competitors engaged in "mass layoffs" in 2022, which they mentioned in quarterly reports and was also reported on in general news. Grab did not, in fact it is one of the few players which seemingly did not engage in layoffs. The mantra on the newspaper that Grab uses is always on these lines “No layoffs despite weaker market”. In reality, Grab’s directors engage in unethical, hazing behaviors to force mass resignations.

review_title: Working as a Grabber for 5 years
pros:
I'm working on training department, what i feel for the past 5 years in here..
- You make an impact for your social through Grab ( earning opportunities )
- You learn a lot, since Grab give you opportunity to learn, we have our own e-learning portal that let you improve your self
- I'm so grateful to be here, be part of Grab family (grabbers), i got a lot of experience how to be a good/better worker, make a lot of good friends, live life @ grab giving me so much opportunity to improve my self
- Grab really appreciate their workers, so many companies that my friends work with, rarely giving us present for their work anniversary. But in Grab you will get it, and the longer the better the present will be and the benefit are sooooo much you will be jealous actually if i can share it hahaha
cons: For me.. it is hard for me, thinking make a career in here longer. a lot of people made Grab as their stepping stone. The system for career sometimes feels off. For example (only example), when my team that consist of 7 people 1 head, 1 manager, 5 peers. On this 5 peers with different grades, whenever somebody will get a promotion to going up, they need to be all the same grade. So my team and my self feel ( T _ T )

review_title: Life at Grab as an Accounting Associate
pros:
Working at Grab as an Accounting Associate is so much fun! Because the technology business model is always challenging and there are always many new things, I often work on financial reporting for various project models. Not only for increasing my accounting skills, those projects also make me collaborate a lot with various parties, and that makes me very happy and proud.
At Grab, I found a very ideal work environment, where all team members, including associates, assistant managers, managers, senior managers, to the Country Head of Finance, work hand in hand to achieve goals with a very strong team work. All team members can share experiences, learn from each other, so that here I can develop my knowledge and personality. Diversity and culture among colleagues make us more united, where every problem solving that occurs is always decided on the best solution that is fair to each other. For career opportunities, everyone has the opportunity as long as they work hard.
cons: Sometimes if you are in a busy season, such as during the monthly closing or year-end audits, you have to work extra hard because the timeline is very tight, even on weekends, if you need to do additional tasks, you have to do it. But do not worry, because the leaders and all other teammates are fully supportive.

job_title: AREA SALES MANAGER in Bandung, West Java
pros:
I really feel that Grab really appreciates new ideas and dares to experiment. So for those of you who have a lot of ideas this place will be a laboratory of your ideas

A very dynamic environment that requires you to be able to always be adaptive to change. Without realizing it, there are many things that we can learn in a relatively short time.

Grab has a system that encourages everyone to always give their best. With this system creates a very supportive environment ranging from the inner circle to cross departments.
cons:
A very dynamic place where everyone has responsibilities and is very hectic. For new joiner, you may feel confused. Especially when conditions are very hectic and difficult to ask because everyone is busy.

I feel that increasing compensation, benefits and leveling up requires a very bureaucratic and very tight process. Management really chooses the best of the best. so that the company has the potential to lose talent due to a long and tight process

review_title: Big Waterfall Company, Despite Them Wanting to be Agile
pros:
- Salary (one of the best in ID)
- Benefits including more annual leaves and paternal leaves compared to your average company
- Stock options
- You can work remotely as long as your manager's OK with it (and they're usually OK as you often work with international teams, so you're going to be spending most of your time in Zoom calls anyways)
- People are usually very chill and open. 
- Work-life balance (despite oncall duties)
cons:
- Waterfall structure: big projects require alignment with a lot of stakeholders
- Constant moving around, as your working team can differ with different projects. Very difficult to build bonds and working relationships, even with owners of the same product (i.e. building bonds with BE engineers as an FE engineer)
- Too big to get anything meaningful done - paperwork is insane and massive.
- Engineers are expected to do a lot of project management (including stakeholder mgmt and timeline mgmt).

review_title: Overall strong business, but facing challenges
pros:
Business is growing quickly. Opportunities to improve the company. Bright coworkers who are passionate.

The business actually seems to be a catalyst for opportunity in SEA. Exciting to see where it can go.
cons:
Time difference is challenging.
Low comp compared to similar roles at other companies.
Leaders are disconnected from lower employees and miscommunication happens frequently.
Many middle managers are good at managing upwards, but do not focus on managing down. This causes distrust and confusion.
Engagement seems low in remote offices, with no signs of improvement. People are leaving fast, and leadership has shown little interest in retaining people.

cons:
1. Need to stop glamourizing over working.
2. Too many people wear their burnout as a badge of honour and are appreciated by the top management ( e.g: I didn't sleep for last 2 days, I don't get time to eat or pee, I have not taken a single day vacation because of work etc.)
3. Your promotion depends on how much you brag and show off  rather than how much value you add. So talented people are never rewarded.
4. There is a culture of pulling others legs to move up. A toxic organization culture which has the approval of top management.
5. High attrition because of the above points. You will hardly find top talents staying here for long.

Lay off employees without informing beforehand, announce at 11 am and lock employee account at 1pm.
